DOCNAME: CASE OF MEHMET REŞİT ARSLAN v. TURKEY
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;David Thór Björgvinsson;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and was serving a prison sentence in ORG prison at the time of his application to the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by police officers from the Anti - Terrorist Branch of ORG on suspicion of membership of an illegal organisation the ORG ( ORG Party ) . According to the arrest report , the applicant resisted the arrest and the police officers had to use force to apprehend him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the investigating judge at ORG , where he denied the allegations against him . The judge ordered the applicant 's detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor at ORG who noted that there was a restriction in the functioning of the right shoulder and elbow .

CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor from ORG drew up a report , according to which there were numerous ecchymoses and lesions on the various parts of the applicant 's body and there was a reduced functioning of the right arm .
CARDINAL . In a further report dated DATE , it was concluded that the injuries on the applicant 's body rendered him unfit for work for DATE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant , along with twentyseven other persons , charging him with membership of an illegal organisation under LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant maintained before ORG that his statements had been taken under torture while in police custody . At the end of the hearing , the court concluded that the applicant 's representative could file a complaint with the authorities about the applicant 's allegations of ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the public prosecutor proposed to alter the charge against the applicant to treason against the integrity of the ORG , a capital offence under LAW .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the first - instance court held DATE hearings . The applicant did not attend QUANTITY of them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted his final defence submissions to the court . In his petition , the applicant denied the charges against him . Repeating his allegations of torture , the applicant maintained that he had been hung from his arms during his police custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to the death penalty under LAW . The death penalty was commuted to a life sentence . In its judgment , the first - instance court did not list the applicant 's statements taken by the police as evidence , having regard to the doctors ' reports . It nevertheless convicted the applicant holding that other evidence corroborated his statements to the police .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . In his petition , he maintained that the judgment of the first - instance court was based on his police statements which had been taken under torture .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .
